mods.note: I I/ £> ‘ QBr £>j|aXA-r. Resident at Bahrain# foreign New Delhi. Repeated. Political Muscat. T/1273. 9th Deeeniber 1943 lie Your telegram Ko. 10671 Becemher 6th. Currency for Muscat. 2. Please see Muscat telegram Bo. C/1571 December 6th. Obvious course is to divert ship as Muscat has been very badly served recently and has had no mail for five months. Only alternative which will cause unnecessary expense is to send notes by air to Political Agent Bahrain who will arrange onward despatch by first available steamer. I do not repeat not recommend dropping notes by parachute. -Resident- ffo. C/499 Office of the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, Camp* Bahrain. Dated the 9th December 1943. Copy f or warded, with compliments, to, The Pol it icallAgent, Bahrain, with the request that he will please arrange to take delivery of the currency notes if and when received, and also arrange for them to be forwarded to Muscat by first available ship under advice to Political Agent, Muscat.

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 4/31 Despatch of Currency Notes to Political Agent Muscat, via Bahrain, for want of direct steamers to Muscat.'

physicalDescription.extent: There is one document only in this file (folio 3); it is followed by a page of notes (folio 4).

Foliation: the foliation sequence commences at the front cover with 1 and terminates at the inside back cover with 5; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file consists of a copy of a telegram from the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf to the Government of India, concerning the despatch of currency for Muscat. The telegram is forwarded by the Office of the Political Resident to the Political Agent, Bahrain, with a request that the Political Agent forward the currency to Muscat by the first available ship.
